item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Notes on building an app that looks like an IKEA manual (56 points | 8 comments)
2. Ledger Implementation in PostgreSQL (21 points | 3 comments)
3. Avoid building a security treadmill (61 points | 16 comments)
4. GPSTracker: A self-hosted FOSS alternative to Google Maps Timeline (23 points | 6 comments)
5. Non-Obvious Haskell Idiom: Conditional For (13 points | 5 comments)
6. Figma’s not a design tool — it’s a Rube Goldberg machine for avoiding code (41 points | 21 comments)
7. The next generation of Bazel builds (10 points | 6 comments)
8. LLMs on a PowerPC Mac (13 points | 3 comments)
9. Triforce: a microphone array beamformer for Apple Silicon laptops (15 points | 1 comment)
10. Notes on coreutils in Rust (52 points | 66 comments)
11. Everyone quotes command line arguments the wrong way (on Windows) (10 points | 10 comments)
12. Post Apocalyptic Computing (2 points | no comments)
13. Exploring Ruby Ractors -- I paid for for 10 cores I'm gonna use 10 cores (17 points | 7 comments)
14. GitButler's new patch based Code Review (Beta) (22 points | 27 comments)
15. The Prospero Challenge (8 points | no comments)
16. Holograms, light-leaks and how to build CSS-only shaders (11 points | 1 comment)
17. RCE Vulnerabilities in k8s Ingress NGINX (9.8 CVE for ingress-nginx) (3 points | 1 comment)
18. Nix derivations by hand (13 points | 3 comments)
19. Bringing Record and Replay everywhere (14 points | no comments)
20. Golang on the PlayStation 2 (18 points | 3 comments)
21. Why Choose to Use the BSDs in 2025 (53 points | 30 comments)
22. A Cassette Audio Control for the Web (21 points | 7 comments)
23. c-ward: An implementation of libc written in Rust (25 points | 3 comments)
24. What are you doing this week? (7 points | 14 comments)
25. argp: GNU command line argument parser (10 points | no comments)
